title: Microhard Bullet-LTE Basic Authorization Header Stack-based Buffer Overflow Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Microhard Bullet-LTE. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability. 
The specific flaw exists within the handling of authentication headers. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of the length of user-supplied data prior to copying it to a fixed-length stack-based buffer. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root.
timeline:
2020-03-03 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2020-08-26 - Coordinated public release of advisory
2020-09-17 - Advisory Updated
